39703437.review:
1/29/18
Homestuck is an amazing story, written and drawn by Andrew Hussie, and the creator of the critically acclaimed game Undertale, composing music for the game. Then they form a game studio, called WHAT PUMPKIN Games, and create an game that became the best of 2017, and brought back the point and click genrie. That came is called HIVESWAP. This is my extensive review. 

Gameplay:
The gameplay is an nostalgic Point and Click game, and works well with that favor. The controls are tight and the strife battles are cool too. It really fits with that story too, it being basic and simple, yet rewarding.

Story and Characters:
The story of Hiveswap ACT 1 takes place in 1994 at the Harley Manor in Hauntswitch in the B1 Universe, following Jude Harley and Joey Claire, 2 siblings that were playing outside with their dog Tesseract as they are attacked by mysterious monsters. Joey, who runs into the house and Jude runs to his treehouse. After Joey finds her way into the Attic via LOTS of puzzles and rushing away from an swarm of monsters, she uses a weird key she found in her room and it stuffs itself into a machine infront of her,then she gets thrown into a Portal from it, transporting Dammek, a Troll from the planet of Alternia planning a Revolt against the abusive Highblood Trizza, to Earth while Joey gets transported to Alternia where she works with a troll named Xefros to find a way back or help with the revolt.

Joey : Joey is an intelligent, even-tempered 14 Yearold girl with a knack of puzzle-solving. Joey is a dancer, practicing both ballet and tap, which she uses to escape some tricky situations in creative ways. She is also an aspiring veterinarian, and keeps a small kit of medical tools on her person.

Due to her difficult childhood, Joey is deeply frustrated with the adults in her life and sometimes feels insecure due to the neglect she faces. Joey has little tolerance towards bullying and abuse, and will not hesitate to stand up for people she sees as being mistreated.

Although she is constantly confronted by strange events and circumstances, she repeatedly shows herself to be adaptive and creative despite it all. All in all, Joey is a survivor which makes her really stand out. 

Jude : Jude is around 10-13 Years old, and is largely defined by his neurotic tendencies and love of conspiracy theories, among them aliens. He constantly investigates strange tabloids and is keeps a close ear on the activities of a Mysterious Cult from a nearby mansion. Although often overly cautious, Jude proves himself to be dependable and is shown knowledgeable in strategy, security and avoidance tactics. He is not above pestering and pranking his sister, however, and is generally a goofy, clumsy kid.

Xefros : Xefros is around 6-7 Sweeps, and is a timid, passive troll with a kind heart and low self-esteem. Due to Dammek's influence and the general mistreatment of low-bloods in Alternia, Xefros does not think highly of himself or any of his abilities, and shows some anxiety over his fading childhood. He has a tendency to apologize a lot. He is also training to be a butler, and is not very excited at the prospect.

He also seems to be more accepting and comfortable around the subject of cleaning supplies and buckets compared to other trolls, and keeps his hive relatively cleaner than his peers.

Despite his weaker tendencies, Xefros shows a compassionate, trusting nature, and is willing to put himself in danger to help someone in need. He is a passionate follower of Dammek's rebellion. 

Unfortunatly, Dammek, and all the others shown in the game don't have anything yet.

Soundtrack :
THIS IS THE BIG ONE, The music is amazing. It fits really well with the atmosphere and is jamming to listen to even without the game. In my opinion, get the soundtrack.

Graphics : 
The graphics are pretty impressive, all of it drawn and cellshaded, and looks really nice and has that MSPA feel. The game was going to be in fully 3D But was cut and reworked due to issues with the budget, but I don't mind because I prefer this version. Animation is really sweet too, and looks fluent. 

Compatability : The game runs well enough. I don't have issues running it, Day 1 was a disaster with low end specs but the game litterally requires NOTHING. You could run this on a Windows XP and it will work (Probably).

Final Verdict: GET IT.

I loved this game. When ACT 2 comes out, I'll tear my wallet out for it. Try it out, even if you don't like Homestuck. I would highly recommend this game.

39685654.review:
I know like nothing about Homestuck apart from shit I skimmed across on the wiki but I really enjoyed this game. The graphics are cartoony but very detailed, soundtrack's nice, there's witty and amusing dialogue with literally every combination of items you can think of, the characters quickly grow on you and the exposition into the game is well done so even someone like me who has no idea what the fuck's going on can quickly grasp it.

There's literally so much personality stuffed into every tiny little room, the storyline is linear but the length can range from two hours to around my playtime depending on how long you spend looking at all the combinations. A few people are saying the price is a bit big for two hours worth of gameplay but considering how much meticulously stuffed in detail you have access to I'd disagree with that.

I'd recommend to any fantasy or point and click game enthusiast regardless whether you've read the webcomic or not. Looking forward to ACT 2 whenever it comes out.

39620719.review:
[h1]Nostalgic 90's feels incoming.[/h1]

Note: I knew nothing about the Hiveswap Fandom or the Homestuck Universe upon starting this game. 

Playing HIVESWAP made me feel like I was a kid in the 90's, waking up early on a Saturday morning so I wouldn't miss the cartoons on Nickelodeon. I have a total playtime of about 3.7 hours. My first play through included reading all dialogue, clicking every item possible and completing all achievements that are currently obtainable, which took about 3 hours. A second, rushed playthrough took only 30 or so minutes.

[h1]Positive[/h1]
+ I felt like I didn't really need to know anything about the Homestuck Universe to understand and enjoy this title.
+ The artwork is wonderful. So beautifully detailed and colorful.
+ Music is catchy and works well with the game.
+ The writing is superb, the wit and humor made me laugh throughout the entire story.
+ I genuinenly felt interested about the characters.

[h1]Negative[/h1]
- I wish the first act was just a little longer. The game at full price was fine for me, but others might want to pick it up on sale.

I don't have many point & click games in my library, so I do not have much experience with them, but I definitely had a ton of fun with HIVESWAP. The fun puzzle elements, combat scenes, and the all around rich story has made me excited to see what the next act has to offer!
